author: Anonym
title: SpaceX Launches U.S. Military Space Drone for Research Mission - The Limited Times
text:
A launch with great fanfare. SpaceX's Falcon Heavy rocket lifted off Thursday night to carry the U.S. X-37B military space drone to a research mission, the U.S. company founded by Elon Musk announced. After weeks of delays, the rocket lifted off at 20:07 p.m. (01 GMT) from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The liftoff was streamed live on SpaceX's website.
No information was available on the destination of the space drone, an unmanned shuttle, for its seventh mission. The Pentagon has released little information about the space drone and its new mission, originally scheduled to start on Dec. 7. SpaceX simply cites the Pentagon's code name for the mission -- USSF-52 -- in its release about the launch. " Falcon Heavy launched the USSF-52 mission into orbit from launch pad 39A ," according to SpaceX. The Pentagon had previously announced that X-37B's seventh mission would feature " multiple state-of-the-art experiments ."
Â«
These tests include the operation of the reusable space plane on new orbital regimes, the experimentation of future technologies on space domain awareness, and the study of the effects of radiation on materials supplied by NASA ," according to a statement issued last month by the U.S. Department of the Air Force's Office of Rapid Capabilities. The statement said it was the first time the X-37B was launched by a Falcon Heavy rocket, one of the most powerful in operation and capable of carrying payloads of up to 26,700 kilograms deep into space.
Little distilled information Shrouded in secrecy, the X-37B made its first flight in 2010 and spent a total of more than ten years in space during its first six missions, its manufacturer, the American aircraft manufacturer Boeing, said at the end of its sixth mission in November 2022. The X-37B was designed for the U.S. Air Force by United Launch Alliance, a joint venture of Boeing and Lockheed Martin.
It is nine meters long, has a wingspan of 4.5 meters, and is powered by solar panels. Its launch by the Falcon Heavy rocket comes two weeks after China launched its own space drone, named Shenlong, into orbit on December 14 for what the state-run New China Agency called " a certain period of time " during which scientific experiments will be conducted " to provide technical support for the peaceful use of space ."

organizations.name: spacex launches u.s. military space drone for research mission

author: @rtesport
title: Littler survives mid-match scare
text:
World champion Luke Littler survived a mid-match scare to advance to the quarter-finals of the Bahrain Darts Masters with a 6-3 victory over Philippine challenger Lourence Ilagan.
The opening round saw the eight PDC superstars take on the eight Asian representatives for a place in Friday's final rounds.
Littler, in his first tournament since claiming his first world title earlier this month, quickly went up 4-1 but allowed his opponent to halve the deficit then secure a seventh-leg break.
The 17-year-old â€“ who was breaking in a new set of arrows â€“ regrouped with a 180 in the next leg and was one leg away from victory after a 142 checkout.
Littler averaged 94.36, adding another 180 en route to wrapping up the win, and will face world number nine Gerwyn Price in Fridayâ€™s last eight.
The evening opened with a major upset after former world champion Rob Cross was defeated 6-3 by Paolo Nebrida, who became the first Filipino to win on the World Series.
Nebrida came out on top of a 29-dart fourth leg, while Cross was undone by poor finishing.
World number one Luke Humphries shut out the host nationâ€™s Abdulla Saeed, hitting six out of six on the doubles in a dominant display.
He will face Nathan Aspinall in the last eight, after 'the Aspâ€™ beat Chinaâ€™s Zong Xiao Chen 6-2.
Chris Dobey, coming off his best run at the PDC World Championship â€“ where he made the semi-finals â€“ rarely looked challenged as he cruised through with a 6-0 victory over the host nationâ€™s Bassim Mahmood.
Dobey will take on Bunting in the quarter-finals, where Peter Wright will play Nebrida after beating the Filipinoâ€™s compatriot Alexis Toylo 6-3.

title: Cine Colombia anuncia cine a $6.000 y comida gratis | La FM
text: [Laura Vanessa Rojas BarragÃ¡n ](/autores/laura-vanessa-rojas-barragan) Cine Colombia sorprende a sus usuarios al anunciar promociÃ³n de cine a $6.000 y comida gratis Cine Colombia anunciÃ³ que el prÃ³ximo 31 de diciembre de 2023 no habrÃ¡ servicio al pÃºblico. Cine Colombia le dio una buena noticia a todos sus clientes. Luego de que el 25 de diciembre, el cinema sorprendiera a sus espectadores con boletas gratis para â€œGatopia: Una Aventura de Pelosâ€, con ocasiÃ³n de Navidad, al parecer, este fin de aÃ±o tambiÃ©n estarÃ¡ lleno de sorpresas. SegÃºn informaron, para esta Ã©poca de fin de aÃ±o, las entradas a las funciones de cine estarÃ¡n a tan solo de 6.000 pesos, incluyendo crispetas gratis. Puede leer: [Cine Colombia se estrena en exclusivo sector de BogotÃ¡ Â¿Desde cuÃ¡ndo?](https://www.lafm.com.co/entretenimiento/cine-colombia-se-estrena-en-exclusivo-sector-de-bogota-desde-cuando) Y quienes quieran asientos preferenciales, podrÃ¡n adquirir sus boletas por 8.000 pesos con una caja de crispetas gratuita. Esta promociÃ³n, que aplica para funciones que inician antes de las 2:00 p. m. tendrÃ¡ vigencia hasta el 30 de este mes. Le puede interesar: [Cine Colombia tendrÃ¡ entradas gratis para el 25 de diciembre](https://www.lafm.com.co/colombia/cine-colombia-tendra-entradas-gratis-para-el-25-de-diciembre) Por otro lado, Cine Colombia anunciÃ³ que el prÃ³ximo 31 de diciembre de 2023 no habrÃ¡ servicio al pÃºblico, por lo que quienes deseen aprovechar la oferta deben programar sus visitas. author: HispanTV
title: La guerra en curso marcarÃ¡ el fin del rÃ©gimen de Israel, vaticina HAMAS | HISPANTV
text:
HAMAS asegura que el Ãºnico destino que le espera a Israel es â€œfracaso totalâ€ ademÃ¡s de destacar que la guerra en curso marcarÃ¡ el fin del rÃ©gimen sionista.
En una rueda de prensa celebrada el jueves en Beirut, la capital de El LÃ­bano, Osama Hamdan, uno de los lÃ­deres del Movimiento de Resistencia IslÃ¡mica de Palestina (HAMAS), reiterÃ³ en que la batalla contra los ocupantes israelÃ­es se considera una batalla de liberaciÃ³n nacional para todos los palestinos.
â€œLos lÃ­deres de la ocupaciÃ³n israelÃ­ cosechan fracaso tras fracasoâ€ en la guerra contra la Resistencia palestina, dijo el portavoz de HAMAS para luego agregar que â€œel rÃ©gimen sionista registrÃ³ su fin polÃ­tico y militar con esta agresiÃ³nâ€.
Cero avance ante HAMAS: Israel ni se ha acercado a las bases en Gaza RefiriÃ©ndose a los decenas de miles de palestinos asesinados durante los 83 dÃ­as que pasan del genocidio israelÃ­ contra Gaza, el titular de HAMAS dijo que solo en las Ãºltimas 24 horas, Israel ha llevado a cabo 20 masacres â€œcon armas estadounidensesâ€.
De acuerdo con Hamdan, la AdministraciÃ³n del presidente de EE.UU., Joe Biden, intenta ocultarse detrÃ¡s de una ficticia preocupaciÃ³n por los civiles, mientras â€œrealmente dirige la guerra, y es responsable de la sangre que se derramaâ€ en Gaza.
HAMAS tacha a Biden de â€œcÃ³mplice del crimenâ€ en masacre israelÃ­ en Gaza
HAMAS: Huir o morir, es destino de tropas de Israel en Gaza | HISPANTV Osama Hamdan, uno de los lÃ­deres de HAMAS, asevera que el destino de las tropas de Israel en la guerra de Gaza es la muerte o la huida.
HAMAS saluda tregua â€œcompleto y definitivoâ€
En otra parte de sus declaraciones, Hamdan afirmÃ³ que estÃ¡n abiertos a cualquier propuesta para un alto el fuego final e infinito en la Franja de Gaza. â€œNuestro pueblo no quiere un cese al fuego fragmentado o temporal, sino completoâ€, afirmÃ³.
En este sentido, indicÃ³ que los lÃ­deres sionistas no verÃ¡n con vida a los israelÃ­es retenidos por los grupos de la Resistencia palestinos, excepto despuÃ©s de un cese total de su agresiÃ³n contra Gaza.
Resistencia pone puntos sobre Ã­es: No hay canje de cautivos bajo fuego TambiÃ©n, dirigiÃ©ndose a las familias de los prisioneros israelÃ­es, Hamdan declarÃ³ que â€œ[el premier israelÃ­, BenjamÃ­n] Netanyahu les estÃ¡ mintiendo porque bajo presiÃ³n militar, vuestros hijos regresarÃ¡n sin vidaâ€ .
HAMAS: 50 cautivos han muerto en Gaza por ataques de Israel Desde el inicio de la agresiÃ³n israelÃ­, el 7 de octubre, los indiscriminados bombardeos y la ofensiva terrestre de la entidad sionista contra Gaza han dejado un saldo de mÃ¡s de 21 300 palestinos muertos, la mayorÃ­a mujeres y niÃ±os, ademÃ¡s al menos 55 600 personas han resultado heridas.
